That’s why @HouseGOP passed the Lower Energy Costs Act to reduce costs for families by $795 a year.

Today we honor the men and women who earned the Purple Heart while defending our great nation. May their bravery and sacrifice never be forgotten.

A couple weeks ago, the House voted to pass historic legislation to reauthorize the FAA and support airports like Hot Springs Memorial Field. Yesterday I visited Memorial Field to see firsthand and discuss improvements that can be made to to better serve AR04 travelers.

I applaud the @SenateCommerce Committee for advancing the bipartisan, bicameral AM Radio for Every Vehicle Act yesterday. I’m proud to lead this effort in the House with my friend @RepJoshG, and I look forward to getting this bill across the finishline.
Mark Lowery was a passionate public servant for the state of Arkansas, and he will be missed. I was proud to stand alongside my colleagues today and honor his legacy on the House Floor.

Today I honored the life and legacy of Mrs. Mary Fisher on the House Floor. Mary had a heart for community service and her mark on the 4th District will not be soon forgotten. My prayers go out to her loved ones during this time.

Today I had the chance to meet with the Arkansas FFA state officer team to discuss the upcoming Farm Bill. My roots in FFA run deep, and as an alumnus of FFA, it's always a pleasure to chat with current members and leaders of this incredible organization.

I'm saddened to hear that former state legislator and Arkansas Treasurer Mark Lowery has passed away. I enjoyed serving with Mark in the State House and appreciate his service to our state. My prayers go out to his family, friends, and all Arkansans mourning this loss.

Today I announced the introduction of the Child Sex Crimes Victims Protection Act - legislation that will significantly reform the way juvenile victims of sex trafficking and abuse are sentenced if they fight back against their abusers.🧵⤵️ (1/5)

President Biden put politics above people and promised millions of hopeful Americans that he would cancel their student loan debt. 

He knew the whole time that he would never be able to constitutionally follow through on that promise.

.@POTUS get your numbers right. CBO  said the 2018 tax cuts would cost $1.3t over 10-years and in January 2019 they projected tax revenue would only be $4.032t in 2022… actually, it was $4.9t! 

Tax cuts work, illegally spending over $400 billion of other people’s money doesn’t.

Biden’s student loan forgiveness plan was clearly unconstitutional, as ruled by the Supreme Court. However, the damage to the American taxpayer has already been done.

This administration must be held accountable for their actions and should develop a plan to reimburse America.

Arkansans can rest easy knowing that we are working together to reduce the  price of gas and utilities at home!

We just PASSED H.R. 1, the Lower Energy Costs Act!

House Republicans are delivering on our promise to unleash American energy!

It's time to deliver on our promises to the American people to lower energy costs, boost our global competitiveness, and unleash American energy independence.

TODAY, we will vote to PASS H.R. 1, the Lower Energy Costs Act!

America is blessed with abundant energy and mineral resources; when we use those resources, we control our economic and national security destinies. When we don't, we simply play into the hands of our foreign adversaries.

Let's pass HR 1 and unleash American energy independence!

Fuel and utility prices are skyrocketing, and House Republicans are not going to stand idle while hard-working Americans pay the price for misguided energy policies.

This week, we're taking action to lower energy costs and end the war on American energy. #HR1

Today we will vote to block the egregious WOTUS Rule.

The Biden Administration is developing bad energy policies motivated more by political science than actual science.

The TAPP American Resources Act is a science-based solution that will get our country back on track and unleash American energy production.

If service members cross state lines for an abortion because it’s illegal where they're stationed, you shouldn't have to pick up the bill.

I’m asking DOD to consider the values of the American people and stop using taxpayer dollars to fund abortions.

Thanks for stopping by! #AR04

At today’s full committee markup, @TransportGOP members approved a joint resolution that will overturn the Biden Administration’s flawed #WOTUS Rule and protect American small businesses and farmers from this egregious federal overreach.

Yesterday I joined Mrs. Culver’s Civics class from Ozark High School on Zoom to chat about the value of being involved in our communities and the importance of making our voices heard by voting, especially in local elections. These young leaders are the future of #AR04!

Our foreign adversaries are purchasing American farmland right under our noses. Meanwhile, we’ve seen a significant lack of accountability and oversight from the USDA to address the threat.

Thank you @RepStefanik for leading the effort to seek answers. Full letter below⤵️

I joined @RepBuddyCarter @RepGolden & @Call_Me_Dutch to introduce bipartisan, common-sense legislation that will ensure that every patient, especially in rural areas, has access to the information they need about their prescription medication.

Read more⤵️ westerman.house.gov/media-ce…

It's only natural that amidst National FFA Week, I joined my colleagues on the Congressional FFA Caucus to urge the USDA to fill a vacancy for its Agricultural Youth Coordinator, who is intended to motivate youth to pursue careers in agriculture and natural resources. #FFAWeek

At a time where the average age of a U.S. farmer is nearly 60 years old, farmers are looking to the next generation to fill their shoes. It’s never been more important to give youth a seat at the table and enhance the agriculture talent pipeline. #FFAWeek

This week I attended the Annual Engineers Luncheon in Little Rock. 
As an engineer by trade, I always appreciate the opportunity to meet with other engineers from across #AR04. I enjoyed hearing their perspectives on energy, critical mineral mining, and climate policies.

Police officers deserve our utmost respect and gratitude for all they do to keep our communities safe. Yesterday, my staff and I visited the Arkansas State Police Department Headquarters. Thank you for having us and thank you for keeping our state safe!

#BackTheBlue

I'm joining @JohnBoozman this morning at @UAMonticello for his second #FarmBill listening session! Looking forward to discussing how we can best support Arkansas agriculture producers and rural communities through the upcoming #FarmBill.

Happy #FFAWeek!

To ensure our country has a bright future, we need bright minds at the forefront of agriculture, and that's where @NationalFFA excels. May this week be a reminder of the strides FFA makes in growing great leaders and contributing to the future of agriculture.

Thanks to Dr. Robin Bowen, President of @ArkansasTech for hosting me yesterday! It was so great to visit with her and meet with students studying agriculture, forestry, and engineering. They are the future of our state, and I was lucky to meet them.

It was a great morning with the Russellville Area Chamber of Commerce. 

Thanks for having me @RsvlAreaChamber!

Great food and great company! I met with Glenwood Mayor Billy Plyer, Nashville Mayor Larry Dunaway, Howard Co. Judge Brent Pinkerton, Pike Co. Judge Eddie Howard, and Murfreesboro Mayor Jim O'Neal to discuss their new roles and how we can work together to best support Arkansans.
This afternoon, my staff and I visited the new Sevier County Medical Center in De Queen. It was a privilege to meet with healthcare professionals from the 4th district and tour such a great facility.

Each week, I join Patrick Massey from @KDQN921 on the phone to discuss what's going on in Washington DC and the 4th District. Today, I was in De Queen and had the opportunity to catch up with Patrick in person. If you don't already, make sure to tune in next time!
Happy #ValentinesDay!

Yesterday I was in the Permian Basin of Texas with @NatResources to hear from industry professionals about how energy production on federal land is benefiting local communities. It's long overdue that we unleash American energy independence once & for all.

Happy Super Bowl Sunday!

Today, Americans are expected to eat 1.45 BILLION chicken wings. 

From the turf on the field to the chicken wings on your table, we couldn’t have the Super Bowl without agriculture. 

As you tune into the game, thank a farmer!🍗🏈

Today I joined leaders from across Arkansas, including Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders and Mayor Charlotte Young to celebrate the opening of Camden Timbers sawmill. 

Forestry plays a crucial role in the success of our state, and I was glad to attend such a momentous occasion.

One of my favorite things to do in DC is give night tours of the Capitol. There is so much history, and it’s a blessing to be able to share it with others. Last night, I had over thirty guests join me for my first night tour of 2023. It was an incredible night.
Make sure you tune into Arkansas Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders for the Republican Response to the President’s #SOTU address.

Biden says he wants to rebuild the backbone of America.
I don't know about you, but to me, rural America is the backbone of our country. Yet, he didn't mention Rural America once. I'm proud to serve Arkansas' 4th District, which is blessed with an abundance of rural communities.

No word yet on the fentanyl crisis. Did you know that every 7 minutes an American dies from a fentanyl overdose? Politics aside, it's time for Congress and the White House to work together to address the opioid epidemic.

The President says he wants to make our communities safer. Well, with over 4.5 MILLION illegal border crossings in 2 years and 9,000 lbs of fentanyl seized in the past 4 months, I agree. It’s time we come together and say enough is enough. Our southern border is not secure.
FACT CHECK: Republicans oppose indiscriminate cuts to Medicare and Social Security (which we have said time and time again is off the table)
We simply cannot raise the debt limit without making proactive, sensible changes to our government’s reckless spending of your taxpayer dollars.

Americans are already paying their fair share of taxes. In fact, tax revenues are higher than ever before. More taxes won’t help working moms and dads put food on the table. Let’s work together to cut spending and support American families.

We have the resources here at home to deliver a clean energy future. 

We need to end our reliance on China and other foreign adversaries and unleash the power of American energy independence.

Biden's plan to generate a manufacturing boom in clean energy isn't possible without incorporating ALL American manufacturing, including domestic mining of critical minerals. That starts with mining at home where we have the best labor and environmental regulations in the world.

Inflation is skyrocketing, and hard-working Americans are paying the price. 

It’s long overdue that the President works with Republicans to cut back on unnecessary spending, streamline and lower costs, and end this out-of-control cycle of debt.

We all know that the COVID-19 emergency is over, and as such, we need to get back to pre-pandemic spending levels. That’ll be one of the first steps in restoring fiscal sanity and getting control of our debt.
At last year’s #SOTU address, President Biden said, “We’ll be stronger a year from now than we are today.” Do you believe our nation is stronger than it was a year ago? Let me know⤵️

Americans faced an abundance of challenges in 2022:
➡️Highest inflation in 40 years
➡️Record high gas prices
➡️Out of control opioid epidemic 
➡️Rising crime rates 
➡️An unsecured southern border 
We can solve these problems. In 1 hour, we’ll hear the President’s plan. Tune in!📺

Tonight, the President will deliver the #SOTU. I look forward to hearing his plans to:
➡️Control consumer price hikes
➡️Reform government spending
➡️Secure our border
➡️Combat Chinese aggression
➡️Ensure Americans always have a brighter and stronger future
I hope you’ll tune in.

I look forward to working with my friends @RepGarretGraves, @RepDavidRouzer, and @RepTroyNehls to continue advancing America’s transportation and infrastructure network.

America is blessed with vast mineral resources that are critical to our nation's success. Instead of locking them up for generations, as the Biden Administration did yesterday, we need to come together to support American mining that's done in the cleanest, most efficient manner.

Today, I joined almost 200 of my @HouseGOP and @WesternCaucus colleagues to support farmers, ranchers, and small businesses in their quest to ensure the Biden Administration’s premature WOTUS rule doesn’t regulate every pond and ditch in America. westerncaucus.house.gov/news…
The Biden Administration owes us some long overdue answers. My colleagues and I are going to hold them accountable.
As winter weather approaches, I encourage everyone in Arkansas to monitor the storm, bundle up, and stay safe!

It's #NationalSchoolChoiceWeek!

As a father and former school board president, I am committed to public education, much like many parents in Arkansas. Parents know their children better than anyone, and they have a right to decide what's best for them when it comes to education.

Every life is precious, no matter what.

Last week, House Republicans passed a bill that will protect the lives of children born from attempted abortions. We must ensure every child's right to a prosperous life is preserved.

The U.S. has hit the debt limit and @USTreasury is taking "extraordinary" measures to keep the government afloat. Let's be honest - it was "extraordinary" spending that got us here.

We have a debt problem. We need to take bipartisan action and change our federal spending habits.
Sending thoughts and prayers to Congressman Steube and his family this evening.
Let's get to work!

I'm honored to continue serving on @TransportGOP. I look forward to working with my colleagues to tackle supply chain problems, reauthorize the FAA, make improvements to our water infrastructure & ensure state & local governments have the resources they need to improve our roads.

Today we honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., who changed the trajectory of America in the pursuit of liberty and justice for all. May this day be a reminder of how far we’ve come and the work that is left to be done. #MLKDay

Happy #NationalArkansasDay!

Today and every day I am incredibly proud to be an Arkansan - and I am especially grateful for the opportunity to serve the Natural State in Washington D.C.

Happy New Year! 

As the year and the 117th Congress comes to a close, I am grateful to reflect on my time in the House of Representatives serving #AR04. It is my highest honor to represent my constituents in Congress, and it is a privilege I never take for granted.
